questions.text: All of them act on GABA receptors except
Droperidol & fentanyl combination is
Choice of induction agent for LMA insertion is
Propofol infusion syndrome consist of all except
Least respiratory depression occurs with
Which of the following may be teratogenic
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • B. Sevoflurane Sevoflurane is considered a safe anesthetic agent for use in pregnant women. Although all volatile anesthetics cross the placenta, sevoflurane has not been shown to have teratogenic effects in humans or animals when used at clinical doses.
  • • C. Desflurane Like sevoflurane, desflurane has not been associated with teratogenic effects in clinical practice. It is commonly used in modern anesthesia and is considered safe during pregnancy when used appropriately.
  • • D. Halothane Halothane, while largely replaced by newer agents, has not been shown to be teratogenic. It crosses the placenta but has no significant evidence linking it to congenital malformations when used at standard doses.
